header.title: BASIC SKRYING - THE 22 HEBREW LETTERS
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Qabalah, Hermeticism, Magical Practice

central_thesis: This document outlines a fundamental skrying methodology for Probationers of the O.S.D.L. to engage with the 22 Hebrew Letters, viewed as representations of the Paths on the Qabalistic Tree of Life, thereby developing visionary faculties as a preparatory stage for more advanced magical work, including Enochian skrying and exploration of the Aethyrs and Paths themselves.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to Skrying the Hebrew Letters
structure_content.summary: This section introduces skrying the 22 Hebrew letters as a mandatory task for Probationers of the O.S.D.L., explaining its purpose as preparation for advanced visionary work and its connection to the Paths of the Tree of Life. It emphasizes that while letters are connected to Paths, they offer distinct visionary experiences.

This chapter details the material and mental preparations for the skrying practice. It instructs the Probationer to print, cut, and paint (preferably in black) templates of Hebrew letters, stressing the importance of performing this painting within one's 'temple space' just before skrying to establish a strong connection. Keeping a journal open for documentation is also advised.

This section provides a step-by-step guide for the skrying ritual, beginning with a Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram (LBRP) and relaxation techniques like the Fourfold Breath. It covers concentration on the letter, a prayer for accuracy, projection 'through' the letter using the Sign of Projection, awaiting visions (visual, auditory, or ideational), vibrating the letter's name to enhance connection, and concluding with banishing rituals and thorough documentation. It also notes the importance of testing visions.

This section consists of visual templates for each of the 22 Hebrew letters (Aleph through Tau), intended to be printed, cut, and used as the physical focus for the skrying exercises described in the preceding chapters.

key_concepts.definition: A magical practice involving concentrated gazing into a symbolic object (in this context, a painted Hebrew letter) to induce visionary experiences, insights, or psychic impressions related to the object's nature or its associated Qabalistic path.

The 22 letters of the Hebrew alphabet, which in Hermetic Qabalah are assigned to the 22 Paths connecting the Sephiroth on the Tree of Life. They serve as primary symbols for meditation, contemplation, and skrying exercises within the O.S.D.L. curriculum.

key_concepts.term: Paths of the Tree of Life
key_concepts.definition: The 22 interconnections between the 10 Sephiroth on the Qabalistic Tree of Life, each attributed to a specific Hebrew letter, Tarot trump, and astrological or elemental principle. Skrying the Hebrew letters is presented as a method to explore the nature of these Paths.
The initial grade or stage of membership within the Order of the Sons and Daughters of Light (O.S.D.L.), for whom these basic skrying exercises are prescribed as fundamental training.

key_concepts.term: O.S.D.L. (Order of the Sons and Daughters of Light)
key_concepts.definition: The specific magical order within which this document's curriculum is implemented, implying a structured initiatory system with assigned coaches and progressive exercises.
An assigned mentor or guide within the O.S.D.L. responsible for overseeing a Probationer's progress in skrying exercises, providing instruction and feedback.

key_concepts.term: LBRP (Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram)
key_concepts.definition: A foundational ritual in Hermetic magic, implied here as the standard 'banishing routine' for opening and closing magical work, intended to clear the ritual space and the practitioner's aura of unwanted influences.

A specific mental or physical technique used to facilitate astral or visionary projection, described as willing oneself 'through' the skried object as if it were a doorway, potentially inducing a sense of disorientation.
A rhythmic breathing exercise (inhale, hold, exhale, hold, each for a count of four) used to induce relaxation, deepen concentration, and prepare the mind for meditative or magical work.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is a structured ritualistic skrying method designed to induce visionary experiences related to the intrinsic nature of the 22 Hebrew Letters and their corresponding Qabalistic Paths. It aims to develop the practitioner's visionary and astral faculties, providing foundational training for more complex magical operations.
tools: Printed Hebrew letter templates (preferably painted black for clarity and focus).
A stable surface (table) for placing the letter.
A journal for immediate documentation of visions.
A candle (optional, for aiding concentration and atmosphere).
A 'Skrying Coach' for guidance and feedback.
rituals: Initial Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram (LBRP) for purification and consecration of space.
Relaxation through rhythmic breathing, specifically the Fourfold Breath.
Concentrated gazing upon a painted Hebrew letter, involving holistic and part-by-part visual analysis.
Recitation of a prayer for truth and accuracy in the vision, invoking divine oversight (God, Christ, HGA, etc.).
Performing the 'Sign of Projection' to astrally or mentally enter 'through' the letter as a doorway.
Passive reception of visions (visual, auditory, or ideational) without straining.
Optional vibration of the Hebrew letter's name to deepen attunement during the vision.
Thorough documentation of the visionary experience.

relevant_quotes.text: Your next task as a Probationer is to skry the 22 Hebrew letters (or, at least, a number of them, though completing them is the goal), either from Aleph to Tau (i.e. A to Z) or from Tau to Aleph (i.e. backwards), in accordance to their attribution on the Paths of the Tree of Life. This choice can be made with the Skrying Coach who will be assigned to you when you feel ready to begin these exercises (feel free to inform the Officers when you feel ready). While these letters are connected to the Paths, they are not the Paths themselves, so offer some differences in terms of the vision (and “scope" of vision) related to them. These exercises should hopefully prepare you for more advanced skrying work, of both the Enochian letters and the Paths and Aethyrs themselves.

Recite a short prayer for Truth and Accuracy in your vision, calling upon God, Christ, your Holy Guardian Angel, or any other “power” you see fit to “oversee” this ceremony. Ask that you receive a true and accurate vision of the nature of that letter, that you are not led astray by preconceptions, illusions, or the willful deception of outside entities. This affirmation often helps to dispel these obstacles and help you “tune in” to the “right channel” for the appropriate letter you have chosen.

With the Sign of Projection (either mental or physical), will yourself through the letter, as if it were a doorway. You may notice a feeling of slight disorientation as you do this (doubly so if you have performed the sign physically with your eyes closed), but this is a natural part of the skrying procedure.

Now relax and await the vision (sit down if you stood to perform the sign). Don't try to strain too much to see – just let visuals or thoughts come to mind. Note that not all “visions” are visual – you might just suddenly think of something, or you might hear something rather than see it. There is nothing wrong with that (we each perceive in different manners), so stick with it and document it later.

critical_analysis.relevance: This document serves as a foundational pedagogical text within the O.S.D.L.'s curriculum, offering a structured and practical introduction to skrying. It is highly relevant for understanding how Neoplatonic and Qabalistic symbolism (Hebrew letters, Tree of Life) is integrated into modern Western Esoteric magical practice, particularly for beginners. It bridges basic meditation and visualization with more advanced astral and visionary work, characteristic of Golden Dawn-derived traditions. The emphasis on detailed preparation and systematic procedure reflects a disciplined approach to magical training.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of 'Probationers' within the O.S.D.L. – individuals at an early stage of magical training who are being systematically introduced to practical occult work. Beyond this specific order, it is also highly valuable for independent students of Hermetic Qabalah, ceremonial magic, or anyone interested in developing skrying and visionary skills using traditional symbolic systems, particularly those who benefit from a clear, step-by-step methodology.
